Articles.Content:
Has anyone else seen this, and more importantly found a way to fix this issue?   

Playing with the ground anchor. I've got it in Bill's inventory, Bill is on the Mun.  I move to where I want the anchor, click the deploy icon, I get the normal popup menu (space to place the part etc) I have the anchor oriented rightside up. When I press the space button to actually place the anchor, the anchor drifts slowly to the ground, the screws don't drive into the ground, and I get a message that the anchor isn't placed on a planet. 

 

Does anyone have any suggestions?

I found my answer with a point in the right direction from a KSP FB user (Antony Piper, Thanks!)...World Stabilizer is the problem. I took it out and viola, it works. I put it back in and again it was failing.

Unfortunately with World Stabilizer taken out, none of my bases, or landed rovers on Minmus survive leaving Minmus and returning. When I go back, as soon as the screen loads, everything that was on the ground, is bouncing around like superballs, or shaking itself apart, or some of the time, flipping over and exploding completely.
